de.ntcomputer.minecraft.controllablemobs.api

Interface ControllableMobActions


  • public interface ControllableMobActions
    An interface which creates actions for an entity. You can order the entity to move or look at certain locations, jump, etc. You can retrieve an instance by using ControllableMob.getActions()
    Version:
    v5
    Author:
    Cybran

    • Method Detail

      • moveTo

        ControllableMobAction moveTo(Location loc)
        Orders the entity to move to the given location. Uses the default queuing flag.
        Parameters:
        loc - the location the entity will move to.
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction
        See Also:
        moveTo(Location, boolean)

      • moveTo

        ControllableMobAction moveTo(Location loc,
                           boolean queue)
        Orders the entity to move to the given location, optionally adding the action to the queue. This action is block accurate, meaning, that the entity will stop once it reached the block the given location is pointing at. When the actions execution is started, all other movements or attacks caused by the AI are stopped and overridden. If a target is assigned to the entity, it will not be lost and dealing with it will be resumed when this movement is finished.
        Parameters:
        loc - the location the entity will move to.
        queue - whether this action should be added to the queue (true) or executed directly (false).
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction

      • lookAt

        ControllableMobAction lookAt(Location loc)
        Orders the entity to look at the given location. Uses the default queuing flag.
        Parameters:
        loc - the location the entity will look at.
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction
        See Also:
        lookAt(Location, boolean)

      • lookAt

        ControllableMobAction lookAt(Entity entity)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException
        Orders the entity to look at the given other entity. Uses the default queuing flag.
        Parameters:
        entity - the other entity this entity will look at.
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the entity itself is specified as target
        See Also:
        lookAt(Entity, boolean)

      • lookAt

        ControllableMobAction lookAt(Location loc,
                           boolean queue)
        Orders the entity to look at the given location, optionally adding the action to the queue. The entity will look at the location by turning its head to it (animated). If the entity moves, it will try to look at the location anyway, turning its head further. This is a background action, it will last until you call lookAt((Location) null), it will not block the queue and other actions can run simultaneously.
        Parameters:
        loc - the location the entity will look at.
        queue - whether this action should be added to the queue (true) or executed directly (false).
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction

      • lookAt

        ControllableMobAction lookAt(Entity entity,
                           boolean queue)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException
        Orders the entity to look at the given other entity, optionally adding the action to the queue. The entity will look at the other entity by turning its head to it (animated). If the entity moves or the entity it looks at moves, the entity described by this ControllableMob will try to look at the other entity anyway, turning its head further. This is a background action, it will last until you call lookAt((Entity) null), it will not block the queue and other actions can run simultaneously.
        Parameters:
        entity - the other entity this entity will look at.
        queue - whether this action should be added to the queue (true) or executed directly (false).
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the entity itself is specified as target

      • target

        ControllableMobAction target(LivingEntity entity)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException
        The given target is assigned to the entity. Uses the default queuing flag.
        Parameters:
        entity - the new target
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the entity itself is specified as target
        See Also:
        target(LivingEntity, boolean)

      • target

        ControllableMobAction target(LivingEntity entity,
                           boolean queue)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException
        The given target is assigned to the entity, optionally adding the action to the queue. The entity will react on this target as declared by its AI. One of the following target behaviors had to be added previously: AIAttackMelee, AIAttackRanged. If none of these have been added, the entity will do nothing with its new target.
        Parameters:
        entity - the new target
        queue - whether this action should be added to the queue (true) or executed directly (false).
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the entity itself is specified as target

      • wait

        ControllableMobAction wait(int serverTicks)
        Orders the entity to wait before executing following actions. Uses the default queuing flag.
        Parameters:
        serverTicks - the amount of server ticks the entity will wait. 20 server ticks = 1 second.
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction
        See Also:
        wait(int, boolean)

      • wait

        ControllableMobAction wait(int serverTicks,
                         boolean queue)
        Orders the entity to wait before executing following actions, optionally this is added to the queue. The "wait" acts like a "placeholder" - it will prevent the entity to run actions from the queue for the given amount of time. The "wait" is an action itself and can therefore be added to the queue. The AI is unaffected by this and will perform actions normally. Parallel actions are unaffected too.
        Parameters:
        serverTicks - the amount of server ticks the entity will wait. 20 server ticks = 1 second.
        queue - whether this action should be added to the queue (true) or executed directly (false).
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction

      • die

        void die()
        The entity dies. Funny, isn't it? The action will be executed immediately.
        See Also:
        die(boolean)

      • die

        ControllableMobAction die(boolean queue)
        The entity will die, optionally the created "action" will be added to the queue. This action will reduce the entities current health down to zero.
        Parameters:
        queue - whether this action should be added to the queue (true) or executed directly (false).
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction

      • jump

        ControllableMobAction jump()
        The entity will jump one time. Uses the default queuing flag.
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction
        See Also:
        jump(int, boolean)

      • jump

        ControllableMobAction jump(int times)
        The entity will jumps as many times as specified. Uses the default queuing flag.
        Parameters:
        times - how often the entity should jump continuously.
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction
        See Also:
        jump(int, boolean)

      • jump

        ControllableMobAction jump(boolean queue)
        The entity will jump one time, optionally the jump is added to the queue.
        Parameters:
        queue - whether this action should be added to the queue (true) or executed directly (false).
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction
        See Also:
        jump(int, boolean)

      • jump

        ControllableMobAction jump(int times,
                         boolean queue)
        The entity will jumps as many times as specified, optionally these jumps are added to the queue. Jumping is independent from movement or attacking, the entity can as well jump and move at the same time.
        Parameters:
        times - how often the entity should jump continuously.
        queue - whether this action should be added to the queue (true) or executed directly (false).
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction

      • follow

        ControllableMobAction follow(LivingEntity entity)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException
        The entity will follow another entity. Uses the default queuing flag. Moving with moveTo(Location, boolean) will override this action. When following (actually moving), the AI is blocked.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity that will be followed
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException
        See Also:
        follow(LivingEntity, boolean, float, float)

      • follow

        ControllableMobAction follow(LivingEntity entity,
                           boolean queue)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException
        The entity will follow another entity, optionally this action is added to the queue before executing. Moving with moveTo(Location, boolean) will override this action. When following (actually moving), the AI is blocked.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity that will be followed
        queue - whether this action should be added to the queue (true) or executed directly (false).
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when entity is the controlled entity itself
        See Also:
        follow(LivingEntity, boolean, float, float)

      • follow

        ControllableMobAction follow(LivingEntity entity,
                           boolean queue,
                           float radius)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException
        The entity will follow another entity, staying within the given radius, optionally this action is added to the queue before executing. Moving with moveTo(Location, boolean) will override this action. When following (actually moving), the AI is blocked.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity that will be followed
        queue - whether this action should be added to the queue (true) or executed directly (false).
        radius - the maximum distance (in blocks) this entity can keep away from the entity it will follow. The default value is 10.0 blocks
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when entity is the controlled entity itself or when the radius is smaller than 2.0
        See Also:
        follow(LivingEntity, boolean, float, float)

      • follow

        ControllableMobAction follow(LivingEntity entity,
                           boolean queue,
                           float outerRadius,
                           float targetRadius)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException
        The entity will follow another entity, staying inside the outerRadius and outside the targetRadius, optionally this action is added to the queue before executing. Moving with moveTo(Location, boolean) will override this action. When following (actually moving), the AI is blocked.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity that will be followed
        queue - whether this action should be added to the queue (true) or executed directly (false).
        outerRadius - the maximum distance (in blocks) this entity can keep away from the entity it will follow. The default value is 10.0 blocks
        targetRadius - the target distance (in blocks) between this entity and the entity to follow when moving to it. The default value is 2.0 blocks
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when entity is the controlled entity itself or when the outerRadius is smaller than the targetRadius

      • callback

        ControllableMobAction callback(Runnable runnable)
        Adds a callback to the action queue. The callback is invoked when all running actions and all actions added before this callback had been executed or cancelled.
        Parameters:
        runnable - the callback instance
        Returns:
        ControllableMobAction

      • isActionRunning

        boolean isActionRunning(ActionType type)
        Returns whether an action of the specified type is currently running.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of which actions should be looked up
        Returns:
        true, when an action of the specified type is running, false otherwise.

      • clearActionQueue

        void clearActionQueue()
        Removes all actions located in the queue. All actions which should be executed after the current actions finish, are being removed immediately.

      • clearActionsRunning

        void clearActionsRunning()
        Removes all actions which are currently executed but haven't finished yet. They are being removed immediately and marked as ActionState.CANCELLED.

      • clearActions

        void clearActions()
        Removes all running actions and all actions located in the queue. All manually added actions are stopped. This is a shorthand for clearActionQueue(); clearActionsRunning();

      • getDefaultQueuingFlag

        boolean getDefaultQueuingFlag()
        Gets the flag, whether actions should be queued automatically.
        Returns:
        a boolean value describing whether actions should be automatically added to the queue (true) when they are added by a method which doesn't provide a boolean queue argument, or whether they should be executed immediately (false). Default value is false

      • setDefaultQueuingFlag

        void setDefaultQueuingFlag(boolean defaultQueue)
        Sets the flag, whether actions should be queued automatically.
        Parameters:
        defaultQueue - a boolean value describing whether actions should be automatically added to the queue (true) when they are added by a method which doesn't provide a boolean queue argument, or whether they should be executed immediately (false).
